name: Cory Wong

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Minneapolis-born Cory Wong is best known for his funky guitar work and touring worldwide playing his original music on the biggest stages. 

You may have seen him as a guest with the house band on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert, as well as a member of Vulfpeck and the Fearless Flyers. 

A celebrated artist in his own right, he has released solo albums including last year's Billboard Top 20 record Motivational Music for the Syncopated Soul, Elevator Music for an Elevated Mood, and, most recently, Live in Amsterdam' With The Metropole Orkest, which charted at #10 on the Billboard Jazz Chart.

name: 2025 Winter Glow
description:
We're transforming downtown Toronto into a festive holiday destination filled with lights, rides, music, artisan vendors, and family-friendly experiences. 

This year, we're proud to welcome Epilepsy Toronto's beloved Holiday Market to the Square with artisan stalls, photo ops, the Polar Point Bar, firepits, and photos with Santa. Visitors can also enjoy the return of the ferris wheel, the Great Canadian Carousel, festive treats, and special brand activations throughout the event.

Opening night will feature a live performance by My Pop Choir, first rides on the Ferris Wheel and Carousel, holiday shopping and seasonal beverages. Join us!

name: Broadsway: The Most Wonderful Time...Maybe
description:
Featuring four of Canada's finest musical theatre, jazz and cabaret artists doing the music of Broadway, their way and delighting audiences in the process!

Featuring Dora Mavor Moore award-nominee Diane Leah, JUNO and ECMA-nominee Heather Bambrick, international touring artist Julie Michels, and jazz/cabaret vocalist Kylie Martin, this is a show that combines musical theatre and humour in a way you may have never seen or heard before.  

Celebrate the season with an evening of Yuletide classics and lesser-known seasonal gems, all put together in unique arrangements with tons of musicality and humour! CBC Radio called it "a musical version of the best Christmas party ever", it's a party you won't want to miss!

name: Baroque and Beyond - Holiday Treats
description:
Offering a festive bouquet of well-loved melodies to celebrate the season! With music from the 18th to 21st centuries, from the famous Overture and Pifa from Handel's Messiah up to Canadian composer Larry Strachan's evocative 'Lament for Souls of Sauteurs' written in 2008. 

The Ezra Duo - violinist Jacob Clewell and pianist Sasha Bult-Ito - will be featured in Mendelssohn's charming Double Concerto in D minor, and Maestro Arman will also lead the orchestra in Vivaldi's Sinfonia L'incoronazione di Dario and Jenkins' famous "diamond music" Palladio.

name: Your Roots Cast A Shadow: Author Reading and Q&A
description: Join us for a free event as author Caroline Topperman shares the incredible stories uncovered after her spontaneous move to her ancestral home in Poland. Her personal history is threaded with the global upheavals of World War II, revealed through the parallel wartime journeys of her two sets of grandparents. She will tell the story of her Jewish maternal grandmother, Paula, who survived the war by fleeing to Uzbekistan, and later simply walked into a medical school in Moscow and was admitted. In contrast, her non-Jewish paternal grandmother, Wandeczka, fought social norms in Kabul, to become the first woman allowed to buy groceries in her local Afghan market. Caroline will conclude by sharing the compelling journey that led her to work at an underground school for girls in Afghanistan.

name: Best of Documentary Shorts Festival
description: Enjoy the best documentary short films from the last year from around the world today followed up with a QnA session with filmmakers after.
